description.value:
In &Reference[humanoid]{humanoid} form, the werebat makes two scimitar attacks or two shortbow attacks. In hybrid form, it can make one bite attack and one scimitar attack.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:
Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: [[/damage 1d6 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage, and the werebat gains temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt. If the target is a &Reference[humanoid]{humanoid}, it must succeed on a [[/save con 10 format=long]] or be cursed with werebat lycanthropy.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:

description.value:

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:
Shapechanger. The werebat can use its action to polymorph into a Medium bat-humanoid hybrid, or into a Large &Reference[giant]{giant} bat, or back into its true form, which is &Reference[humanoid]{humanoid}. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isnâ€™t transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:
Echolocation (Bat or Hybrid Form Only). The werebat has &Reference[blindsight]{blindsight} out to a range of 60 feet as long as itâ€™s not &Reference[deafened]{deafened}.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:
Keen Hearing. The werebat has advantage on &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (&Reference[prc]{Perception}) checks that rely on hearing.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:
Nimble Escape (&Reference[humanoid]{Humanoid} Form Only). The werebat can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:
Sunlight Sensitivity. While in sunlight, the werebat has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (&Reference[prc]{Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].
